text: I stand before you not as an expert, but as a concerned citizen, one of the 400,000 people who marched in the streets of New York on Sunday, and the billions of others around the world who want to solve our climate crisis.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: As an actor, I pretend for a living.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: I play fictitious characters, often solving fictitious problems.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: I believe that mankind has looked at climate change in that same way, as if it were a fiction, as if pretending that climate change wasn't real would somehow make it go away.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: But I think we all know better than that now.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Every week, we're seeing new and undeniable climate events, evidence that accelerated climate change is here right now.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Droughts are intensifying.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Our oceans are acidifying, with methane plumes rising up from the ocean floor.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: We are seeing extreme weather events and the West Antarctic and Greenland ice sheets melting at unprecedented rates, decades ahead of scientific projections.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: None of this is rhetoric, and none of it is hysteria.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: It is fact.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: The scientific community knows it.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Industry knows it.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Governments know it.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Even the United States military knows it.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: The Chief of the U.S.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Navy's Pacific Command, Admiral Samuel Locklear, recently said that climate change is our single greatest security threat.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: My friends, this body
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Perhaps more than any other gathering in human history now faces this difficult but achievable task.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: You can make history or you will be vilified by it.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: To be clear, this is not about just telling people to change their light bulbs or to buy a hybrid car.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: This disaster has grown beyond the choices that individuals make.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: This is now about our industries and our governments around the world taking decisive, large-scale action.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Now must be our moment for action.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: We need to put a price tag on carbon emissions and eliminate government subsidies for oil, coal, and gas companies.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: We need to end the free ride that industrial polluters have been given in the name of a free market economy.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: They do not deserve our tax dollars.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: They deserve our scrutiny, for the economy itself will die if our ecosystems collapse.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: The good news is that renewable energy is not only achievable, but good economic policy.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: This is not a partisan debate, it is a human one.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Clean air and a livable climate are inalienable human rights.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And solving this crisis is not a question of politics, it is a question of our own survival.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: This is the most urgent of times and the most urgent of messages.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: honored delegates, leaders of the world, I pretend for a living, but you do not.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: The people made their voices heard on Sunday around the world, and the momentum will not stop.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: But now it is your turn.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: The time to answer humankind's greatest challenge is now.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: We beg of you to face it with courage and honesty.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Thank you.
speaker: SPEAKER_00
